page.title: 10PLACES OF WORSHIP
page.content: Kilmington has a church and a chapel, both of which are well-attended. {THE CHURCH.} The Church of St. Giles was built in 1862. It is made of stone and has stained glass windows. The roof is mostly slate, but there are also tiles, and there is a tower with a clock which strikes the quarter hours. The vicar of our parish is also responsible for Shute and Whitford. There is a churchyard which is still used for burials. {THE CHAPEL. The Baptist Chapel was built in 1832 and is attended by people who live in Kilmington and who come from outside the village.
